items.title: Live: Australian dollar hits 15-month highs, gold breaches $US4,900
items.description: The Australian share market is likely to open flat despite a rally on Wall Street, as investors showed signs of relief a day after US President Donald Trump dropped tariff threats against eight European countries and ruled out seizing Greenland by force. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

items.title: Interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS reaches rare opposition today

featured_image.name: New images capture rare interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS passing ...

items.description:
The interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS reaches a rare and fleeting celestial alignment today, positioning itself directly opposite the sun from Earth's perspective and offering scientists a once-in-decades opportunity to study material from another star system before the enigmatic visitor departs forever.

At 13:00 UTC on January 22, 2026, 3I/ATLAS will align to within just 0.69 degrees of the Earth-Sun axis—an exceptionally small angle that creates ideal conditions for what astronomers call an "opposition surge," a phenomenon that will cause the object to appear brighter and reveal more about its composition. Unlike typical cometary oppositions that last only hours, this alignment will keep 3I/ATLAS within two degrees of the axis for approximately one week.[1][2][3]

items.title: Webb telescope solves mystery of how crystals form in icy comets

featured_image.name: Webb telescope captures 'breathtaking' images of Orion Nebula

items.description:
The James Webb Space Telescope has delivered a striking one-two punch of cosmic discoveries this week, capturing the clearest infrared images ever taken of the Helix Nebula while also solving a decades-old puzzle about how crystals found in comets formed in the frozen reaches of space.

NASA unveiled the new Helix Nebula images on Tuesday, offering an unprecedented look at one of the most photographed planetary nebulas in the sky. Located 650 light-years from Earth in the constellation Aquarius and often called the "Eye of God," the nebula has never appeared with such detail.[1][2][3]

items.title: Shell weighs sale of Argentina shale assets, sources say

featured_image.name: Vaca Muerta shale formation propels Argentina closer to ...

items.description:
Shell is considering selling some or all of its assets in Argentina's Vaca Muerta shale formation, a move that would mark a surprise exit by one of the region's earliest backers just as international interest in the massive play intensifies, according to a Reuters report citing three sources familiar with the matter.[1][2]

The oil major has approached potential buyers in recent weeks to gauge interest in the holdings, which are likely to be valued in the billions of dollars, two of the sources said. However, a sale is not guaranteed, and Shell could still choose to retain the assets. The company declined to comment.[2][3][1]

items.title: Live: Pathway back to Coalition not there right now, Littleproud says
items.description: Nationals leader David Littleproud says he is open to working with Liberal leader Sussan Ley again "at some point", but right now the two parties need "a bit of time apart". Follow live.

items.title: Specialist police teams fly in to hunt suspect after three shot dead
items.description: Tactical police and military personnel join a growing air and land search for a man police have identified after three people were shot dead in a remote New South Wales town on Thursday.

items.title: Officers fire shots as police car is rammed in Melbourne
items.description: Police say officers shot at a four-wheel-drive, which was allegedly driven at two officers in Dandenong on Thursday night.

items.title: Trump and China offer dueling visions on trade at Davos

featured_image.name: New trade map takes shape in Davos as world adjusts to Trump tariffs

items.description:
The 2026 World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, became a stage for clashing economic worldviews this week as President Donald Trump defended his aggressive tariff policies while Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng championed multilateralism and free trade—a split that is accelerating the reshaping of global economic alliances.

Trump addressed the forum on Wednesday, touting what he called an "economic miracle" achieved through tariffs that he said slashed the U.S. monthly trade deficit by 77 percent in one year. "Virtually all of the so-called experts predicted my plans to end this failed model would trigger a global recession and runaway inflation. But we have proven them wrong," he declared. He criticized European economic policies, stating that "certain places in Europe are not even recognizable, frankly, anymore."[1]

items.title: Catastrophic fire danger as seven-day heatwave engulfs south-east states
items.description: South-east states are predicted to bake through a prolonged severe heatwave from Saturday onwards, which has the potential to break all-time temperature records and fuel another round of dangerous bushfires.

items.title: Earthquake monitors can track falling space debris, study finds

featured_image.name: China says most rocket debris burned up during re-entry ...

items.description:
Scientists have demonstrated that earthquake monitors can track falling space debris through sonic booms, offering a new method to pinpoint where dangerous fragments land as the skies become increasingly crowded with satellites.

Researchers reported Thursday that seismic readings from sonic booms generated when a discarded Chinese crew capsule module reentered over Southern California in 2024 allowed them to place the object's path nearly 20 miles farther south than radar had predicted from orbit, according to findings published in the journal Science.[1][2][3]

"The problem at the moment is we can track stuff very well in space," said Benjamin Fernando of Johns Hopkins University, the lead researcher. "But once it gets to the point that it's actually breaking up in the atmosphere, it becomes very difficult to track."[2][4]

items.title: Anger and confusion after Australian courier Sendle collapses
items.description: The Australian company's customers feel like they have been "ghosted", while investors and shareholders are angry and confused about what happens next.

items.title: EU suspends trade deal approval amid Trump's Greenland push

featured_image.name: E.U. halts approval of U.S. trade deal after Trump's Greenland tariff ...

items.description:
President Donald Trump declared Thursday that the United States would have "total access" to Greenland under a framework agreement reached with NATO, even as the European Union suspended approval of a bilateral trade deal in response to weeks of tariff threats tied to the Arctic territory.

Trump's announcement, made from the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, marked an apparent de-escalation after he withdrew his threat to impose 10% tariffs on eight European nations beginning February 1. But the deal's specifics remain unclear, and Denmark has firmly stated its sovereignty is not up for negotiation.

items.title: Trump touts 'total access' Greenland deal as NATO asks allies to step up
items.description: The leaders of both Denmark and Greenland say they are not aware of what is in the deal, announced by the US president earlier this week.

items.title: One Nation's rise in popularity changes the context of the Coalition's divorce
items.description: It is impossible to view this week’s events without the broader context of the relationship between the Liberals and the Nationals, how the electoral map is changing and what that means for right-wing politics in Australia.

items.title: Gold tops $4,900 per ounce for first time amid global turmoil

featured_image.name: Gold notches record above $4,700/oz, silver hits all-time high

items.description:
Spot gold crossed the $4,900-per-ounce threshold for the first time on Thursday, while platinum surged to an all-time high, as investors piled into precious metals amid escalating geopolitical tensions and turmoil in global bond markets.

The historic rally extends gold's extraordinary run into 2026, with the metal gaining 11% since the start of the year and approximately 75% over the past 12 months. Platinum, meanwhile, rose 3% to reach a record $2,558.20 per ounce, having climbed nearly 160% over the past year.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: NATO to bolster Arctic security after Trump-Rutte discussions

featured_image.name: U.S. President Trump Attends World Economic Forum In Davos

items.description:
Global powers are escalating their competition for dominance in the Arctic as melting ice opens new shipping routes and exposes vast mineral reserves, transforming the region into what military and political leaders describe as a strategic frontier of the 21st century.

The race intensified this week when NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte announced that alliance members would move to enhance Arctic security following discussions with U.S. President Donald Trump at the World Economic Forum in Davos. Rutte told Reuters that NATO would "convene alongside senior commanders to determine what actions are necessary," expressing confidence the alliance could accomplish this "quite swiftly" by 2026.[1]

Finnish President Alexander Stubb said he aims to have an Arctic security strategy ready before the NATO summit scheduled for July in Turkey.[2]

items.title: Zelenskyy flags talks with US, Russia, says Europe is 'lost' dealing with Trump
items.description: The Kremlin is yet to comment on the Ukrainian president's announcement, made at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

items.title: Trump, Kushner unveil $25B plan to rebuild Gaza at Davos

featured_image.name: US touts 'New Gaza' filled with luxury real estate

items.description:
President Donald Trump and his son-in-law Jared Kushner presented Thursday a sweeping vision to transform war-ravaged Gaza into a luxury coastal destination, unveiling a $25 billion reconstruction plan at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, alongside the formal launch of Trump's "Board of Peace" initiative.

The announcement included a pledge from Ali Shaath, head of the newly formed National Committee for the Administration of Gaza, that the Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt would reopen next week for the first time since Israeli forces took control of it in 2024.[1][2][3]

items.title: Scientists find black hole growing 13 times faster than theory allows

featured_image.name: Supermassive black holes shrouded by dust in the early universe

items.description:
An international research team has discovered a supermassive black hole in the early universe growing at 13 times the theoretical speed limit, challenging current models of how these cosmic giants form and evolve.

The discovery, announced Wednesday by scientists at Waseda University and Tohoku University in Japan, used observations from the Subaru Telescope to measure gas motion around a black hole that existed when the universe was less than 1.5 billion years old. The findings, published in The Astrophysical Journal, reveal an object accreting matter at rates that defy conventional astrophysics.[1][2][3]

items.title: Osaka apologises for 'disrespectful' interview comments aimed at opponent
items.description: Naomi Osaka walks back her aggressive retort to a tense handshake between her and second-round opponent Sorana Cirstea.

items.title: President Trump Announces U.S. Military Airstrike in Venezuela
items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.title: Trump Meets Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago for Gaza Ceasefire Phase Two Talks
items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.title: Feds Launch Massive Taxpayer Fraud Probe in Minnesota After Viral Video
items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.title: Americans Express Widespread Opposition to AI Data Centers
items.description: Public backlash against AI infrastructure data centers grows, with protests and demands for bans influencing Democratic Party strategies for future elections[3].

items.title: Elon Musk's Humanoid Robot Vision: China Poised to Lead Production
items.description: China prioritizes humanoid robots in tech race with U.S., ramping up production while warning of industry bubble and potential bottlenecks[3].

items.title: Trump-Putin Call Amid Ukraine-Russia Tensions Over Peace Plan
items.description: President Trump spoke with Putin amid ongoing Ukraine conflict, with Russia reevaluating peace plan tenets after Ukrainian denials[1].

items.title: Democratic Gubernatorial Candidates in Wisconsin Focus on Inflation and Trump
items.description: Seven Democrats vying for Wisconsin governor blame economic issues on Trump and emphasize affordability ahead of 2026 primary[3].
